examples: Eccentric she may be but no one pulls the wool over her eyes.
Artistic taxidermy took an eccentric route in the Victorian Era with the introduction of anthropomorphic taxidermy.
But not everyone appreciates the eccentric decorations.
But this eccentric bird is actually a species of nocturnal flightless parrot.
Then draw a bunch of lines from this eccentric point to the circumference of the circle.
words.defineEn: behaving in a manner that is considered different and strange
words.defineVi: cư xử theo cách được coi là khác biệt và kỳ lạ

examples: Finally, the third part of the Milankovitch cycle is a feature known as eccentricity.
And they generally found people could accurately tell where a gaze was directed up to 6 degrees eccentricity.
So in approximately 74,000 years, eccentricity, precession, and sea ice should all align to make it very cold again.
But rather than changing the angle of sunlight, the main effect of eccentricity is changing the lengths of the seasons.
They had participants stare straight ahead, so a face straight ahead would be 0 degrees eccentricity, and in line with their shoulders would be plus and minus 90 degrees eccentricity.
words.defineVi: hành vi kỳ lạ và độc đáo

examples: What I've just done here is I've discriminated, I've discriminated amongst consumers depending on consumers willingness to pay, I've essentially charged them different prices and also, to some degree, based on where they shop and their gullibility, I am charging them two completely different prices.
words.defineEn: tendency to believe too readily and therefore to be easily deceived
words.defineVi: xu hướng tin tưởng quá dễ dàng và do đó dễ dàng bị lừa dối

examples: Even then, somebody was making a fast buck out of fleecing gullible patients.
The corrupt politicians and the gullible voters are the reason our country is in such a mess.
So were his patients just gullible idiots, or was there something else going on?
But if nothing else, kids are more sophisticated and less gullible than you might guess.
The fact that we’re all a little gullible is actually a positive thing.
words.defineEn: (of a person) quick to believe or trust without questioning or doubting the truthfulness or reliability of something
words.defineVi: (của một người) nhanh chóng tin tưởng hoặc tin tưởng mà không đặt câu hỏi hoặc nghi ngờ về tính trung thực hoặc độ tin cậy của điều gì đó

examples: Sternberg also thought a venturesome personality contributes to creativity.
words.defineEn: disposed to venture or take risks
words.defineVi: sẵn sàng mạo hiểm hoặc chấp nhận rủi ro

examples: A barrage of questions and criticism for the CEOs of Twitter and Facebook, appearing virtually before a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing on censorship, disinformation, and the 2020 election.
Late today, another barrage of rockets was fired from Gaza into Israel.
I’m now going to barrage you with very large numbers.
If a retailer has gotten access to your contact information like your email, you will also be barraged with personalized ads and offers.
Four rockets were fired from Southern Lebanon into Northern Israel, the third barrage from Lebanese territory in the past week.
words.defineEn: address with continuously or persistently, as if with a barrage
words.defineVi: địa chỉ liên tục hoặc liên tục, như thể với một rào cản

examples: Soon after, the barren planet crosses Mercury's orbit.
A superhabitable planet would do away with these barren landscapes to support more species and more diversity.
Which is a lot of action for a barren rock with no air!
Deforestation may turn lush tropics into a barren patch, like a successful ensemble breaking up after losing its star performers.
At the north edge of Santa Rosa city limits, you will find a barren lot marked by charred stumps and an empty pool.
words.defineVi: không cung cấp nơi trú ẩn hoặc thức ăn

examples: Owing to legal changes, young barristers can no longer earn easy money on undefended divorces, which are now done by solicitors.
words.defineEn: a lawyer in the UK, Australia, and some other countries entitled to argue cases in the higher courts of law
words.defineVi: một luật sư ở Vương quốc Anh, Úc và một số quốc gia khác có quyền tranh luận về các vụ kiện tại các tòa án pháp luật cấp cao hơn

words.defineEn: something that serves to indicate or suggest
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó phục vụ để chỉ ra hoặc đề nghị

examples: Lichen serves as an indicator of air quality due to its sensitivity to pollution.
The rise of extremist groups in recent years is a clear indicator of the fact that history repeats itself when we don't learn from our mistakes.
Okay, so the green light on here is the battery indicator light.
The levels would show a low indicator.
Location is another key indicator.
words.defineEn: something that is used to measure a particular condition or value
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được sử dụng để đo lường một điều kiện hoặc giá trị cụ thể

examples: A year after the Charlottesville rally, the U.S. attorney's office in Virginia indicted eight RAM members or associates.
Using the state's anti-gambling laws, prosecutors indicted 17 people from an international sports gambling ring just a few months ago.
John McAfee, the developer of the antivirus software, has been indicted on fraud and money laundering charges.
A federal grand jury has indicted four former Minneapolis police officers involved in the death of George Floyd with violating his civil rights.
US prosecutors then indicted Clíver Alcalá on drug-trafficking charges, and he turned himself in to US authorities.
words.defineVi: cáo buộc chính thức của một tội phạm

examples: Yet. 1984 is an indictment of specific governments.
The Miami Herald and others report a federal indictment in Miami names at least five suspects.
And the speech itself, Trump’s speech, is a searing indictment of the prior administration.
- Today we are announcing the indictment of a federal savings bank on mortgage fraud, securities fraud, and conspiracy.
Was it an early indictment of market-driven economies?
words.defineEn: a formal accusation of a crime
words.defineVi: một lời buộc tội chính thức của một tội phạm

examples: It's obfuscating a puzzle hidden beneath.
Now, this fact can sometimes be used in bad faith to obfuscate the horror of what Europeans did.
words.defineVi: làm tối nghĩa hoặc không rõ ràng

examples: No matter the obfuscation or the destiny of his legal pros, the wars was down to its essential issue.
And the answer they came up with is chaos, disruption, lies and obfuscation.
words.defineEn: the activity of obscuring people's understanding, leaving them baffled or bewildered
words.defineVi: hoạt động che khuất sự hiểu biết của mọi người, khiến họ bối rối hoặc hoang mang

examples: He’s drinking a lot of beer, getting fat and wiling away his time uselessly.
words.defineEn: the use of tricks to deceive someone (usually to extract money from them)
words.defineVi: việc sử dụng các mánh khóe để lừa dối ai đó (thường là để lấy tiền từ họ)

examples: Confronted with a choice between his freedom and his precious riches, the wily leprechaun may offer his captor three wishes instead of the loot, or some other temptation.
Changes were coming that not even wily monarchs could adapt to.
Popular culture, however, drew on pagan mythology, full of wily sorceresses and enchantresses using love potions and charms to work their magic.
Even before he arrived, the wily Loki was already scheming how he would get the dwarves to do his bidding.
So when Zeus asked him to decide how sacrifices would be made, the wily Prometheus planned a trick that would give humans some advantage.
words.defineEn: skillful in achieving what one desires, especially through deceptive means
words.defineVi: khéo léo trong việc đạt được những gì một người mong muốn, đặc biệt là thông qua các phương tiện lừa đảo

examples: And we can always abort the mission, right.
In 2018, a propellent leak was found in the engine of the Starliner capsule during a launch abort test.
They said that we should have been aborted.
If something goes squirrely with the big rocket you can just punch the launch abort system and it'll pull the capsule away, saving the humans.
It’ll also come with safety features like a launch abort system that automatically shoots the capsule away from the rocket if something goes wrong.
words.defineEn: to terminate an undesired pregnancy before the fetus reaches a viable age
words.defineVi: để chấm dứt một thai kỳ không mong muốn trước khi thai nhi đến tuổi khả thi

examples: And the second largest wave of immigrants was made up of German speakers, including a number of liberals who left after the abortive revolutions of 1848.
words.defineEn: failing to produce or accomplish the desired outcome
words.defineVi: không tạo ra hoặc đạt được kết quả mong muốn

examples: That sounds like an old jeremiad.
I mean, I would like to just hear Eddie give that jeremiad to the American people.
words.defineVi: một khiếu nại dài và thương tiếc
